channel.title: Rnaseq on LittleBitofData
channel.description: Recent content in Rnaseq on LittleBitofData

item.title: A typical RNASeq analysis
item.description: This is a typical RNASeq analysis pipeline, not atypical. Purpose Given RNASeq data from two group of samples (sequenced from mice), control and treatment, find out the differentially expressed genes. Scripts can also be found in https://github.com/zhengh42/RNASeq_MM. Download reference and prepare index ####### # These steps are performed in linux/bash, in reference/ directory # Script location: reference/run_download_index.sh # Kallisto and Salmon are from pre-built Docker images. Scripts for building the images can be found in https://github.

item.title: Strandness in RNASeq
item.description: How to tell whether the paired-end sequencing reads in an RNASeq library are strand-specific or not? According to how read 1 and read 2 align to DNA and RNA sequences, there are three types of RNASeq libraries: If sequences of read 1 align to the RNA strand, the library is “stranded”. If sequences of read 2 align to the RNA strand, the library is “reversed stranded”. Sometimes sequences of read 1 align to the RNA strand; the other times sequences of read 2 align to the RNA strand.
